perturbation.original_text:
Article
2
"Affiliate" means, in relation to Party A, any enterprise or other entity which,
directly or indirectly, controls, or is controlled by, Party A; the term
"control" meaning ownership of fifty percent (50%) or more of the registered
capital or voting stock or the power to appoint the general manager, factory
chief or other principal person in charge of an enterprise or other entity.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article
2
"Affiliate" means, in relation to Party A, any enterprise or other entity which is associated, loosely affiliated or has a cooperative agreement with Party A; the determination of affiliation will be decided on a case by case basis without any ownership requirements. There will be no specific requirements or thresholds for being considered an affiliate, allowing for broad interpretation.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by redefining "Affiliate." The original text defines it based on control (50% ownership), while the changed text broadens the definition to loosely affiliated and cooperative entities with case-by-case determination. This conflicts with other sections relying on the original definition to determine rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Article
2
"Affiliate" means, in relation to Party B, any company which, through ownership
of voting stock or otherwise, directly or indirectly, is controlled by, under
common control with, or in control of, Party B; the term "control" meaning
ownership of fifty percent (50%) or more of the voting stock or the power to
appoint or elect a majority of the directors or the power to direct the
management of a company.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article
2
"Affiliate" means, in relation to Party B, any company that Party B decides to designate as an affiliate. Party B has sole discretion in designating affiliates, and such designation does not require any specific level of control, ownership, or influence. The term "control" as it relates to affiliates of Party B is not applicable.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text contradicts the original definition of "Affiliate" for Party B. Originally, affiliation was defined by control (50% ownership, appointment of directors, etc.). The altered text gives Party B sole discretion to designate affiliates without any ownership or control requirements. This creates ambiguity because other sections might rely on the original definition when determining affiliate rights and obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Article 45
The parties to this Contract agree that the technology, documentation and
know-how provided under the Contract for Technology Investment and the technical
services provided under the Contract for Technology Investment are provided for
the use of the Joint Venture Company. Party A hereby undertakes to Party B and
the Joint Venture Company that:

        (1)    Party A and its Affiliates shall not at any time during or after

               purpose of marketing and selling batteries produced by the Joint
               Venture Company;
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 45
The parties to this Contract agree that the technology, documentation and
know-how provided under the Contract for Technology Investment and the technical
services provided under the Contract for Technology Investment are provided for
the use of the Joint Venture Company. Party A hereby undertakes to Party B and
the Joint Venture Company that:

        (1)    Party A and its Affiliates may, at any time during or after
 the Contract Term, use such technology and know-how for any purpose, including purposes competitive with the Joint Venture Company, as long as it is not directly in competition within the Hebei Province.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the original confidentiality and non-compete intentions by allowing Party A and its affiliates to use the technology and know-how outside of Hebei Province, regardless of whether they are marketing Joint Venture products or doing something else, especially given the revised definition of Affiliate.
